AVSEC ORDER 1  / 2000 
 
SUB : BAN ON  EMPLOYMENT OF PRIVATE SECURITY 
 
 
1. 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Rule 3 (2A) and now 3A of 
Aircraft Rule 1937 (SO.NO1343 / 1988), the Commissioner of security, Civil 
Aviation for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations at the civil airports 
in India directs that in order to ensure effective enforcement of security controls 
in accordance with the guidelines issued form time to time by the Bureau of Civil 
Aviation Security each Airline operator operating  at the airports in India, who has 
been given the responsibility of carrying out certain security related procedures 
pertaining to their flight, shall deploy their own regular employees and shall not 
engage private security agencies to carry out such security related functions of 
their flights and such regular employees shall be registered with the Bureau of 
Civil Aviation Security with immediate effect. 
 
 
(VEERANNA AIVALLI) 
COMMISSIONER OF SECURITY (CA) 
 
REF.NO.CAS-5(4)/97-DIV-I    Dated : 17.01.2000
